page.title: 12CHURCHILL CARILLON
page.content: The Churchill Carillon was formed in 1983 when six ladies got together, initially for their own pleasure and amusement, to play the handbells. The bells had been bought for Â£7 in 1922 by the PCC for the tower ringers to practise change ringing, and in later years were only used by the school children. When the school was closed in 1981 they were virtually forgotten until the Carillon was formed. The ringers found that they were in great demand for functions at local groups such as Women's Institutes,old people's clubs, Christmas parties, etc. The Carillon was in fact able to raise Â£500 in one year to have the bells tuned and re-handled, and now play on many occasions for charity.
